eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Raycaster3D
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Find 3D objects that cross a line.
description: - Target objects from a 1st person view
- Make AI that detect objects in their field of view

eventsFunctions.description: Define helper classes JavaScript code.
eventsFunctions.name: DefineHelperClasses

eventsFunctions.description: Sends a ray from the given source position and angle, intersecting the closest object. The intersected object will become the only one taken into account.
eventsFunctions.name: RaycastWithAngle
eventsFunctions.sentence: Cast a ray from _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_; _PARAM4_ toward a rotation of _PARAM5_¬∞, an elevation of _PARAM6_¬∞ and max distance of _PARAM7_ against _PARAM1_

parameters.description: Objects to test against the ray
parameters.name: Object

eventsFunctions.description: Sends a ray from the given source position to the final point, intersecting the closest object. The intersected object will become the only one taken into account.
eventsFunctions.name: RaycastBetweenPosition
eventsFunctions.sentence: Cast a ray from _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_; _PARAM4_ to _PARAM5_; _PARAM6_; _PARAM7_ against _PARAM1_

parameters.description: Objects to test against the ray
parameters.name: Object

eventsFunctions.description: Sends a ray from the center of the camera, intersecting the closest object. The intersected object will become the only one taken into account.
eventsFunctions.name: RaycastFromCameraCenter
eventsFunctions.sentence: Cast a ray from the camera center to a maximum distance of _PARAM2_ against _PARAM1_

parameters.description: Objects to test against the ray
parameters.name: Object

eventsFunctions.description: Sends a ray from the given source point on the camera screen, intersecting the closest object. The intersected object will become the only one taken into account.
eventsFunctions.name: RaycastFromCameraPoint
eventsFunctions.sentence: Cast a ray from the camera point _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_ to a maximum distance of _PARAM4_ against _PARAM1_

parameters.description: Objects to test against the ray
parameters.name: Object

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Smoothly follow an object at a distance.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ThirdPersonCamera

events.comment: Update private properties through setters to check their values and initialize state.

eventsFunctions.description: Move the camera closer to the object. This action must be called after the object has moved for the frame.
eventsFunctions.name: MoveCameraCloser

events.comment: The camera following is called with an action, the call from doStepPreEvents must be disabled to avoid to do it twice.

eventsFunctions.description: Move the camera closer to the object.
eventsFunctions.name: DoMoveCameraCloser

events.comment:
At each frame, the camera must catchup the target by a given ratio (speed)
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - 1) - targetX) * (1 - speed)

The frame rate must not impact on the catch-up speed, we don't want a speed in ratio per frame but a speed ratio per second, like this:
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - 1s) - targetX) * (1 - speed)

Ok, but we still need to process each frame, we can use a exponent for this:
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - timeDelta) - targetX) * (1 - speed)^timeDelta
cameraX(t) = targetX + (cameraX(t - timeDelta) - targetX) * exp(timeDelta * ln((1 - speed)))

pow is probably more efficient than precalculated log if the speed is changed continuously but this might be rare enough.
